summary: The term "built-up area" refers to regions characterized by dense construction and urban development, as defined in various EU legal and regulatory frameworks. It encompasses zones where infrastructure, residential, and commercial buildings are concentrated, impacting town planning and environmental assessments. In the context of EU legislation, built-up areas are critical for implementing sustainable urban development policies, land-use regulations, and assessing the implications of construction activities on local ecosystems. Understanding built-up areas is essential for compliance with EU directives aimed at promoting efficient land management and enhancing urban resilience against climate change.
